properties.Status: March: 7.00am to 8.30pm, April to September: 7.00am to 6.30pm.
properties.Description: This walkway opened in 1990 to commemorate pioneer and suffragette Kate Sheppard who fought hard to help New Zealand women get the right to vote in 1893. The white camellia is a symbol of women's suffrage in New Zealand and many camellia along this walk were gifted by the Canterbury women's groups.

properties.Status: Daily, 10.15am to 4pm
properties.Description: Visit Cuningham House, a traditional Winter Garden, for tropical plants from around the globe including Peperomia, Anthurium and even Banana trees. Two staircases lead to the upper floor where you can gaze over the extensive tropical plant collection from the large peripheral gallery.

properties.Status: Daily, 10.15am to 4pm
properties.Description: Visit Gilpin House for carnivorous plants, bromelians and orchids. The connecting Garrick House fhouses a vast collection of cacti and succulents as well as  painted diorama of a desert scene that spans from South Africa to South America by Gordon Gee.

properties.Status: Daily, 10.15am to 4pm
properties.Description: Foweraker House with an enchanting collection of alpine plants that frequently change throughout the year.

properties.Status: Daily, 10.15am to 4pm
properties.Description: On the perimeter is Fern House which offers a peaceful oasis of native ferns including the iconic Silver Fern. A gentle stream meanders through the Fernery creating a perfect environment for moisture loving ferns such as Asplenium.

properties.Status: March: 7.00am to 8.30pm, April to September: 7.00am to 6.30pm.
properties.Description: The Azalea Garden is nestled beneath a canopy of mature oaks and silver birches and surrounded by a large collection of magnolias. The azaleas hit their peak between mid-October and mid-November.

properties.Status: March: 7.00am to 8.30pm, April to September: 7.00am to 6.30pm.
properties.Description: Set in the picturesque Armstrong Lawn, the Peacock Fountain was purchased from the famous Coalbrookdale Foundry in Shropshire, England and erected in 1911. It moved location twice before being dismantled in 1949. Public support called for its restoration and it was recommissioned in 1996 after recasting, cleaning, strengthening and painting the pieces. This iconic fountain has long been a contentious piece in the art world with its colours and form often criticised but it is nonetheless seen by many Cantabrians as an integral part of the Botanic Gardens.

properties.Status: March: 7.00am to 8.30pm, April to September: 7.00am to 6.30pm.
properties.Description: The colours, textures and forms of the rock garden are most vibrant and noticeable in spring. With a collection made up mostly of alpine plants, the terraced south facing slopes are the ideal growing conditions for them.

properties.Status: March: 7.00am to 8.30pm, April to September: 7.00am to 6.30pm.
properties.Description: This grove of Japanese maple cultivars form an attractive feature at the west end of the Herbaceous Border.

properties.Status: March: 7.00am to 8.30pm, April to September: 7.00am to 6.30pm.
properties.Description: Stunning formal bedding displays throughout spring and summer have been a staple here since the late 19th century. Annuals, biennials, shrubs and herbaceous perennials are used to provide colour, texture, form and scent.

properties.Status: March: 7.00am to 8.30pm, April to September: 7.00am to 6.30pm.
properties.Description: Set between the herbaceous border and the wall separating Christ College from the Botanic Gardens, the College Border is an attractive display of texture and form as spring begins to push its way into the Gardens.

properties.Status: March: 7.00am to 8.30pm, April to September: 7.00am to 6.30pm.
properties.Description: This garden demonstrates many techniques to best utilise a small garden space including raised beds, seasonal crop rotation, companion plants and fruit trees trained in creative directions.

properties.Status: March: 7.00am to 8.30pm, April to September: 7.00am to 6.30pm.
properties.Description: This extensive Conifer collection began prior to the Second World War and includes many mature species including cedar, cypress, fir, larch, juniper, pine and spruce.

properties.Status: Daily, 10.15am to 4pm
properties.Description: Townend House is a flowering conservatory and is full of colourful conservatory flowers all year round such as Cyclamen, Begonias and Primula.

properties.Status: September to May: 9am to 5pm, closed Christmas Day.
properties.Description: The award winning Visitor Centre houses a gift shop, exhibition space, function room and café. Here, you will find information about the Botanic Gardens and other Christchurch attractions through the friendly Visitor Centre team and the many maps and brochures available.

properties.Status: March: 7.00am to 8.30pm, April to September: 7.00am to 6.30pm.
properties.Description: Delighting children for years with its swings, slides and monkey bars, this playground now also features a wheelchair swing.

properties.Status: March: 7.00am to 8.30pm, April to September: 7.00am to 6.30pm.
properties.Description: Off Rolleston Avenue, this car park enters the Gardens from the Armagh Street footbridge, near the playground.

properties.Status: March: 7.00am to 8.30pm, April to September: 7.00am to 6.30pm.
properties.Description: Off Riccarton Avenue, this car park borders the Hagley Park tennis courts and enters the Gardens from the West Bridge.

properties.Status: March: 7.00am to 8.30pm, April to September: 7.00am to 6.30pm.
properties.Description: With less than 25 in the world, this peace bell was installed in 2006 in commemoration of Christchurch's status as a peace city. Gifted by The World Peace Bell Association in Tokyo, the bell is made of coins and medals from around the world and symbolises the world being one.

properties.Status: March: 7.00am to 8.30pm, April to September: 7.00am to 6.30pm.
properties.Description: Erected in 1926 to commemorate bandsmen who died in the First World War, the Rotunda acts as a venue for a wide range of musical acts. During spring, thousands of daffodils flower around it creating a particularly pleasant and peaceful atmosphere.
